clusters.title: What Happens If Iran Shuts Down the Strait of Hormuz?

items.title: What Happens If Iran Shuts Down the Strait of Hormuz?
items.standfirst: The Strait of Hormuz is one of the most sensitive pressure points in the global economy. Conflict in Iran could put it at risk indefinitely.
items.content: The Strait of Hormuz is one of the most sensitive pressure points in the global economy. Conflict in Iran could put it at risk indefinitely.

items.title: What will war in Iran do to the global economy?
items.standfirst: Conflict has exposed how much growth depends on energy supplies through the Strait of Hormuz
items.content: Conflict has exposed how much growth depends on energy supplies through the Strait of Hormuz

items.title: How US-Israel attacks on Iran threaten the Strait of Hormuz, oil markets
items.standfirst: About 20-30 percent of global oil and gas supplies are shipped through the Strait of Hormuz.
items.content: About 20-30 percent of global oil and gas supplies are shipped through the Strait of Hormuz.

ai_summary: Strait of Hormuz is a sensitive global economy pressure point
Conflict in Iran could put the strait at risk indefinitely
About 20-30 percent of global oil and gas supplies are shipped through
US and Israel have launched attacks on Iran
Global oil markets are at risk due to the conflict

items.title: FBI probes "potential nexus to terrorism" in deadly Texas bar shooting
items.standfirst: Fourteen people were hospitalized, including three in critical condition, after the shooting at Buford's, a beer garden in Austin's entertainment district.
items.content: Fourteen people were hospitalized, including three in critical condition, after the shooting at Buford's, a beer garden in Austin's entertainment district.

items.title: Deadly Texas bar shooting is 'potentially an act of terrorism', FBI says
items.standfirst: Two people were killed and 14 injured, with the suspected gunman also shot dead on the scene.
items.content: Two people were killed and 14 injured, with the suspected gunman also shot dead on the scene.

Two people were killed and the suspected gunman was shot dead
The FBI is investigating the shooting as a potential act of terrorism
The shooting occurred at a beer garden in Austin's entertainment district
Three people are in critical condition after the shooting

clusters.title: At least 22 people dead after pro-Iran protests in Pakistan and Iraq
clusters.neutral_headline: Pro Iran Protests Turn Violent In Pakistan And Iraq

items.title: At least 22 people dead after pro-Iran protests in Pakistan and Iraq
items.standfirst: US government buildings in Karachi and Baghdad targeted by crowds after killing of Ayatollah Ali KhameneiAt least 22 people are dead following pro-Iran demonstrations in Pakistan that have seen hundreds of people march on the US consulate in Karachi. Security forces in Iraq have also fired teargas at protesters who tried to storm the US embassy in Baghdad.As anger boiled over after US-Israeli strikes killed Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, a crowd of demonstrators in Karachi chanted against the offensive before entering the reception hall of the consulate building and lighting a small fire. Continue reading...
items.content: US government buildings in Karachi and Baghdad targeted by crowds after killing of Ayatollah Ali KhameneiAt least 22 people are dead following pro-Iran demonstrations in Pakistan that have seen hundreds of people march on the US consulate in Karachi. Security forces in Iraq have also fired teargas at protesters who tried to storm the US embassy in Baghdad.As anger boiled over after US-Israeli strikes killed Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, a crowd of demonstrators in Karachi chanted against the offensive before entering the reception hall of the consulate building and lighting a small fire. Continue reading...

items.title: Death of Ali Khamenei : Pro-Iranian regime protesters attack US consulates
items.standfirst: On Sunday in Karachi, at least nine protesters were killed during violent clashes outside the US consulate. The protesters rallied after US and Israeli strikes in Iran led to the death of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, and attempted to force their way into the diplomatic compound. Police responded with gunfire and tear gas to disperse the crowd. The violence spread to other Pakistani cities where rallies also turned violent. Security around US diplomatic sites has been tightened.
items.content: On Sunday in Karachi, at least nine protesters were killed during violent clashes outside the US consulate. The protesters rallied after US and Israeli strikes in Iran led to the death of Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, and attempted to force their way into the diplomatic compound. Police responded with gunfire and tear gas to disperse the crowd. The violence spread to other Pakistani cities where rallies also turned violent. Security around US diplomatic sites has been tightened.

ai_summary: At least 22 people are dead after pro-Iran protests in Pakistan and Iraq
US government buildings in Karachi and Baghdad were targeted
Security forces in Iraq fired teargas at protesters near the US embassy
Protesters in Karachi chanted against the US before entering a consulate
The violence spread to other Pakistani cities with rallies turning violent

clusters.title: UK personnel just 200 metres away from Iranian missile strike
clusters.neutral_headline: UK Personnel Near Iranian Missile Strike In Bahrain

items.title: UK personnel just 200 metres away from Iranian missile strike
items.standfirst: British forces in Bahrain and Iraq being drawn into Iran conflict in defence of civilian sites and military assetsUS-Israeli attack on Iran – live updatesThree hundred British personnel were within 200 metres (650ft) of an Iranian missile and drone strike on the US naval base in Bahrain on Saturday, one of several incidents where UK forces have been drawn into the war in the Middle East.No casualties were reported. The strike was one of more than 25 waves of retaliatory attacks in response to the massive US-Israeli joint bombing campaign launched against Iran on Saturday. Continue reading...
items.content: British forces in Bahrain and Iraq being drawn into Iran conflict in defence of civilian sites and military assetsUS-Israeli attack on Iran – live updatesThree hundred British personnel were within 200 metres (650ft) of an Iranian missile and drone strike on the US naval base in Bahrain on Saturday, one of several incidents where UK forces have been drawn into the war in the Middle East.No casualties were reported. The strike was one of more than 25 waves of retaliatory attacks in response to the massive US-Israeli joint bombing campaign launched against Iran on Saturday. Continue reading...

items.title: UK troops and civilians in Middle East put at risk by Iran strikes, Healey says
items.standfirst: British military personnel at a base in Bahrain were "within several hundred yards" of a strike, the defence secretary says.
items.content: British military personnel at a base in Bahrain were "within several hundred yards" of a strike, the defence secretary says.

ai_summary: British forces in Bahrain and Iraq are being drawn into the Iran conflict
UK personnel were within 200 meters of an Iranian missile strike
The strike was one of many retaliatory attacks by Iran
No casualties were reported among the British personnel
The UK is defending civilian sites and military assets in the region

clusters.title: India set up England semi-final at T20 World Cup

items.title: India set up England semi-final at T20 World Cup
items.standfirst: India secure a T20 World Cup semi-final showdown with England after a five-wicket victory over West Indies thanks to Sanju Samson's scintillating unbeaten 97.
items.content: India secure a T20 World Cup semi-final showdown with England after a five-wicket victory over West Indies thanks to Sanju Samson's scintillating unbeaten 97.

items.title: India beat West Indies by five wickets to enter T20 World Cup semifinals
items.standfirst: Samson hits 97 not out, West Indian bowling falters in Kolkata as India set up World Cup semifinal against England.
items.content: Samson hits 97 not out, West Indian bowling falters in Kolkata as India set up World Cup semifinal against England.

items.title: T20 World Cup: South Africa beat Zimbabwe, set up New Zealand semifinal
items.standfirst: South Africa win by five wickets despite Sikandar Raza's all-round heroics; will play the first semifinal in Kolkata.
items.content: South Africa win by five wickets despite Sikandar Raza's all-round heroics; will play the first semifinal in Kolkata.

ai_summary: India secured a T20 World Cup semi-final spot against England
Sanju Samson hit 97 not out in the match against West Indies
India won the match by five wickets
The semi-final match will be played against England
South Africa also won to set up a semi-final against New Zealand

clusters.title: Suspected Russian ‘shadow fleet’ tanker seized in North Sea
clusters.neutral_headline: Suspected Russian Shadow Fleet Tanker Seized

items.title: Suspected Russian ‘shadow fleet’ tanker seized in North Sea
items.standfirst: Belgian special forces boarded the Ethera, which was sailing under the flag of Guinea, on Saturday nightBelgium has seized an oil tanker believed to form part of the so-called “shadow fleet” used by Russia to circumvent western sanctions over the war in Ukraine.Special forces assisted by French helicopters boarded the ship in a clandestine operation in the North Sea on Saturday night, Belgium’s defence minister, Theo Francken, said on Sunday. Continue reading...
items.content: Belgian special forces boarded the Ethera, which was sailing under the flag of Guinea, on Saturday nightBelgium has seized an oil tanker believed to form part of the so-called “shadow fleet” used by Russia to circumvent western sanctions over the war in Ukraine.Special forces assisted by French helicopters boarded the ship in a clandestine operation in the North Sea on Saturday night, Belgium’s defence minister, Theo Francken, said on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Russian shadow fleet' tanker seized in Belgian-French North Sea raid
items.standfirst: An oil tanker suspected of belonging to the Russian shadow fleet has been seized in the North Sea in a joint Belgian-French operation.
items.content: An oil tanker suspected of belonging to the Russian shadow fleet has been seized in the North Sea in a joint Belgian-French operation.

ai_summary: A suspected Russian shadow fleet tanker was seized in the North Sea
Belgian special forces boarded the tanker on Saturday night
The tanker was sailing under the flag of Guinea
The seizure was a joint operation with French helicopters
The tanker is believed to be part of Russia's shadow fleet

clusters.title: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
clusters.neutral_headline: Military Plane Carrying Banknotes Crashes In Bolivia

items.title: At least 20 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.
items.content: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

items.title: At least 20 killed as cash-laden military cargo plane crashes in Bolivia
items.standfirst: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia’s capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...
items.content: Riot police use teargas to disperse people gathering around wreckage of plane loaded with money from central bankAt least 20 people have died and dozens have been injured after a military cargo plane carrying banknotes crashed while landing near Bolivia’s capital on Friday, damaging about a dozen vehicles on a highway and scattering bills on the ground, an official has said.Footage from local media showed people rushing to collect banknotes while police in riot gear tried to disperse them using teargas. Authorities were later seen setting the money alight in a bonfire at the scene of the crash. Continue reading...

ai_summary: At least 20 people were killed in a military plane crash in Bolivia
The plane was carrying banknotes from the central bank
Riot police used teargas to disperse crowds near the crash site
People were trying to collect banknotes from the wreckage
The authorities later set the money alight in a bonfire
